nodes.bodyText:
not going to have any impacts on the UI of any of the major auth plugins?
(assume not but just checking)

I hope not - most of the tests passed (did not run ATH) - and any security authN/AuthZ plugin using toString() has a huge bug anyway as fullNames can be user controlled.
I anticipate some test failures in some plugins if they are checking logs contain some message (as "Jane Doe" will now be "janedoe" or similar) but I am not expecting production code to break - but I also have not actively gone looking.

NB: "most" above was because I was running on windows and there are known failures ;(
The ATH run as part of the PR passed according to Jenkins - so that is a very good sign that there is not a "huge ammount" of sillyness going on in the codebase
There's very minimal ath tests run on PRs: https://github.com/jenkinsci/acceptance-test-harness/search?q=SmokeTest&unscoped_q=SmokeTest

an internal run on CloudBees infrastructure showed no new failing ATHs and no regressions in the PCT of the plugins we support.
There where a large amount of failures - mainly due to a scrolling issue with the latest core and ATH (should be fixed in jenkinsci/acceptance-test-harness#586) but I now consider this tested.
